com.tofik.coolexoplayer.exoplayer

Interface Playable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExoPlayable

    public interface Playable
    Define an interface to control a playback, specific for SimpleExoPlayer and PlayerView. This interface is designed to be reused across Config change. Implementation must not hold any strong reference to Activity, and if it supports any kind of that, make sure to implicitly clean it up.
    Since:
    3.4.0

    • Method Detail

      • prepare

        void prepare(boolean prepareSource)
        Prepare the resource for a SimpleExoPlayer. This method should: - Request for new SimpleExoPlayer instance if there is not a usable one. - Configure Playable.EventListener for it. - If there is non-trivial PlaybackInfo, update it to the SimpleExoPlayer. - If client request to prepare MediaSource, then prepare it. This method must be called before setPlayerView(PlayerView).
        Parameters:
        prepareSource - if true, also prepare the MediaSource when preparing the Player, if false just do nothing for the MediaSource.

      • setPlayerView

        void setPlayerView(@Nullable
                   com.google.android.exoplayer2.ui.PlayerView playerView)
        Set the PlayerView for this Playable. It is expected that a playback doesn't require a UI, so this setup is optional. But it must be called after the SimpleExoPlayer is prepared, that is after prepare(boolean) and before release(). Changing the PlayerView during playback is expected, though not always recommended, especially on old Devices with low Android API.
        Parameters:
        playerView - the PlayerView to set to the SimpleExoPlayer.

      • getPlayerView

        @Nullable
com.google.android.exoplayer2.ui.PlayerView getPlayerView()
        Get current PlayerView of this Playable.
        Returns:
        current PlayerView instance of this Playable.

      • play

        void play()
        Start the playback. If the MediaSource is not prepared, then also prepare it.

      • pause

        void pause()
        Pause the playback.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Reset all resource, so that the playback can start all over again. This is to cleanup the playback for reuse. The SimpleExoPlayer instance must be still usable without calling prepare(boolean).

      • release

        void release()
        Release all resource. After this, the SimpleExoPlayer is released to the Player pool and the Playable must call prepare(boolean) again to use it again.

      • getPlaybackInfo

        @NonNull
PlaybackInfo getPlaybackInfo()
        Get current PlaybackInfo of the playback.
        Returns:
        current PlaybackInfo of the playback.

      • setPlaybackInfo

        void setPlaybackInfo(@NonNull
                     PlaybackInfo playbackInfo,
                     boolean isMute)
        Set the custom PlaybackInfo for this playback. This could suggest a seek.
        Parameters:
        playbackInfo - the PlaybackInfo to set for this playback.
        isMute -

      • addEventListener

        void addEventListener(@NonNull
                      Playable.EventListener listener)
        Add a new Playable.EventListener to this Playable. As calling prepare(boolean) also triggers some internal events, this method should be called before prepare(boolean) so that Client could received them all.
        Parameters:
        listener - the EventListener to add, must be not null.

      • removeEventListener

        void removeEventListener(Playable.EventListener listener)
        Remove an Playable.EventListener from this Playable.
        Parameters:
        listener - the EventListener to be removed. If null, nothing happens.

      • addOnVolumeChangeListener

        void addOnVolumeChangeListener(@NonNull
                               CoolPlayer.OnVolumeChangeListener listener)
        !This must only work if the Player in use is a CoolExoPlayer.

      • removeOnVolumeChangeListener

        void removeOnVolumeChangeListener(@Nullable
                                  CoolPlayer.OnVolumeChangeListener listener)

      • isPlaying

        boolean isPlaying()
        Check if current Playable is playing or not.
        Returns:
        true if this Playable is playing, false otherwise.

      • setVolume

        @Deprecated
void setVolume(float volume)
        Deprecated. use setVolumeInfo(VolumeInfo) instead.
        Change the volume of current playback.
        Parameters:
        volume - the volume value to be set. Must be a float of range from 0 to 1.

      • getVolume

        @Deprecated
float getVolume()
        Deprecated. use getVolumeInfo() instead.
        Obtain current volume value. The returned value is a float of range from 0 to 1.
        Returns:
        current volume value.

      • setVolumeInfo

        boolean setVolumeInfo(@NonNull
                      VolumeInfo volumeInfo)
        Update playback's volume.
        Parameters:
        volumeInfo - the VolumeInfo to update to.
        Returns:
        true if current Volume info is updated, false otherwise.

      • getVolumeInfo

        @NonNull
VolumeInfo getVolumeInfo()
        Get current VolumeInfo.
